Dan has founded three profitable web-related companies including a freelance operation and a branding agency in New Jersey, a development firm in Los Angeles, CA, as well as multiple social networking websites. A published mentor in the web-design field at 16, Dan possesses the creative insight necessary to bring users and code together in a seamless, effortless union of digital goodness.

These internships were negotiated and completed with top agencies in New York City, Los Angeles, and even one with a satellite branch of a company based in The United Arab Emirates. Dan is constantly thinking of new ideas and ways of making the Internet a more entertaining, safe, and effective means of communication. He has an artistic, deeply rooted attention to detail as well as an understanding of the way people think; acquired through his studies of philosophy and psychology. These traits allow Dan to design intuitive interfaces that grasp the userâ€™s attention, hold it tightly, and send it in the right direction, without causing confusion or unrest.

Although a happy-go-lucky goof ball, Dan has an analytical, problem-solving machine for a brain. He is a kind person with a sarcastic sense of humor. He enjoys life above all things and tries his best to keep smiles on the faces of those around him. A Renaissance man with a twist, Dan does what he can to give back to the community, including a non-profit initiative to aiding Los Angelesâ€™ homeless by selling t-shirts and sending all profits to organizations such as Coalition for the Homeless, Homeless Housing, Beyond Shelter, Women Are Dreamers, Too, and Housing Opportunities for Women (HOW). He enjoys socializing with friends, culinary arts, Bazooka Bubble Gum, pasta, drawing, and building kinetic and still sculptures.
